thread.title: Doctor, nurse hurt in Ifugao clash
thread.title_full: Doctor, nurse hurt in Ifugao clash

title: Doctor, nurse hurt in Ifugao clash

organizations.name: communist party of the philippines-new people's army

text:
Doctor, nurse hurt in Ifugao clash By Artemio Dumlao (philstar.com)   3:38pm In this photo taken Nov. 23, 2016, members of the New People's Army communist rebels with face painted to conceal their identities, stand in formation during ceremonies before a news conference held at their guerrilla encampment tucked in the harsh wilderness. AP/File photo 
LA TRINIDAD, Philippines – Government forces said a physician and a nurse were among those wounded in the recent clash in remote Namal, Asipulo, Ifugao where an alleged rebel encampment was overran. 
Taking cues from identification cards left behind by wounded and fleeing rebels after the encounter in Barangay Namal, Aspulo on Sunday night, soldiers named physician Ana Marie Leung and nurse Isabelle Anne Ramos as among those hurt during an hour gunfight. 
Lt. Col. Nicolas Quemado, commander of the 54th Infantry Battalion (IB) said they found Leung’s Professional Regulation Commission ID card and two automated teller machine cards, including Ramos’ postal identification card at the rebel camp. 
Leung was believed to be one of those wounded in Sunday’s firefight after a villager reportedly identified her as one of those brought by retreating rebels, the military official said. 
Government troops also believed that the troops at Namal, Asipulo are top cadres of the Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army (CPP-NPA). 
“What we fought are the heads of the Ifugao NPA command,” said Quemado. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
Quemado made an appeal and said: "We are open to help their comrades, knowing that the victim is a female and a physician. We need to set aside our differences and help each other to save lives. After all, we are all Filipinos.” 
The military official also urged the families of Leung and Ramos to communicate with them to claim the identification and ATM cards of their relatives. 
According to the 54th IB, pursuit operations against the fleeing rebels are still ongoing. 
Quemado said that they are now coordinating with the Anti-Money Laundering Council (AMLAC) for the possible freezing of the bank accounts believed as being used by the CPP-NPA Ifugao. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
